heading: berners-lee in mp3; quicktime
subheading: world wide web creator tim berners-lee talks to wired news about his invention. interview by chris oakes.
author: chris oakes
text: world wide web creator tim berners-lee chronicles the development of his invention in a new book,  weaving the web. berners-lee spoke with wired news about the web's development, his thoughts about its current state, and his predictions for the future.you can read the text highlights of the interview, or listen to the full 31-minute exchange in mp3 or quicktime audio formats.sample audio highlights of tim berners-lee speaking on:his outlook for the world wide webmp3quicktime audioknowing the web would be bigmp3quicktime audiothe importance of open standardsmp3quicktime audiothe web as an ipo machinemp3quicktime audio
